location: Barnette BOG Room, Erickson Alumni Center, Morgantown, West Virginia ALSO: Zoom information will be provided on the West Virginia University Board of Governors website prior to the meeting
purpose: 1/ Call to Order; 2. Potential Executive Session, under authority in West Virginia Code Sections 6-9A-4(b)(2)(A), (b)(9), and (b)(12) to discuss: a. Potential strategic initiatives relating to academic and administrative priorities; personnel matters; corporate collaborations and financial matters relating to public private partnerships; the purchase, sale or lease of property; and other deliberative matters involving commercial competition which, if made public, might adversely affect the financial or other interest of the University; and b. Confidential and privileged report by General Counsel; 3. Discussions Emanating from Executive Session  if any; 4.  Academic Affairs Updates - Followed by a Report on Rural Healthcare in West Virginia; 5. Annual Report of the Student Government Association Representative to the Board of Governors; 6. Approval of minutes for February 18, 2022 Regular Board Meeting and March 10, 2022 Special Board Meeting; 7. Committee Reports For - 1. April 21, 2022 - Audit Committee Meeting, 2. April 21, 2022 - Academic Affairs and Accreditation Committee Meeting, and 3. April 21, 2022 - Joint Finance and Facilities and Revitalization/Strategic Plans and Initiatives Committee Meeting - including: a. Approval of Fiscal Year 2023 Capital Expenditure Bond Resolution; and b. Approval of Amended and Restated Agreement between WVU and Sodexo America, LLC for Athletic Concessionaire Services; 8. Presidents Report; 9. Information Items (Written Only) - including a. Organizational (Departmental) Change at the West Virginia University School of Medicine (Biochemistry and Molecular Medicine),  b. Establish a Department of General Business within the John Chambers College of Business and Economics, and c. Report of Real Property Transactions - Third Quarter of FY 2022; 10. Consent Agenda (for Board Review and Action) - including a. Approval of New Program:  AA Mental Health and Addiction Studies (Potomac State College), b. Approval of New Program:  BIS Bachelor of Integrated Studies (Potomac State College), c. Approval of new graduate certificate in Media Solutions and Innovation in the Reed College of Media, d. Approval of the Master of Science (MS) in Medical Laboratory Science degree program in the School of Medicine, e. Approval of the Master of Public Health (MPH) degree program in the School of Public Health, f. Approval of a new Master of Science in Engineering Management (MSEM) degree in the Benjamin M. Statler College of Engineering and Mineral Resources, g. Coliseum Courtside Club Budget Increase, h. Interim Appointments to the West Virginia University Health System Board of Directors, i. Appointment to the West Virginia University Alumni Association, Inc. Board of Directors, j. Board of Governors Nominating Committee Appointments, and k. County Extension Appointments; 11. Other Business and General Discussion; 12. The next regular board meeting is scheduled for June 24, 2022; and 13. Adjournment Other items may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-293-2562 or at the website: http://bog.wvu.edu/ - items of interest may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of meeting.

location: SOS Office - Virtual via Conference Call Dial +1 304-306-8300 Phone Conference ID: 120 356 694#
purpose: *Facts and circumstances of the emergency required by W. Va. Code ยง 6-9A-3(h):Pursuant to W. Va. Code ยง 6-9A-2(2)(C), an emergency meeting is required to avoid imminent substantial harm to a public agency or members of the public served by the Secretary of State as the states chief election official following the Final Order of the Kanawha County Circuit Court to effectuate the Court's ruling in State ex rel. Stine v. Warner, et al., which decision was rendered in the afternoon of May 4, 2022. The Court ruled that a Senate candidate is ineligible, and directed the Secretary to issue an order to the affected counties to refrain counting any votes cast for the ineligible candidate and to post signs on polling place doors notifying the voters of the disqualification. The Secretary's order-issuance authority in W. Va. Code sss 3-1A-6(a) requires prior consultation with the State Election Commission. With election day scheduled for May 10, 2022, this emergency meeting is to meet that consultation requirement at the earliest opportunity.

agency: WV WIRELESS TOWER ACCESS ASSISTANCE FUND REVIEW COMMITTEEWV PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION
location: VIA CONFERENCE BRIDGE To reserve time to address the WV WTAAFRC contact ROBERT HOGE, CHAIR 304.425.4911 Option 6 Mercer911@citlink.net
purpose: THIS IS THE REGULAR MONTHLY MEETING OF THE TAAFRC. The agenda is belowAGENDA FOR 5-31-2022 TOWER ACCESS ASSISTANCE FUND REVIEW COMMITTEE MEETING1.Roll call and determination of whether a voting quorum is present.2.Approval of minutes of previous meeting.  March 29, 2022. No meeting in April3. Financial report.4.Media items, if any. 5- WTAAF matters dealt with by any TAAFRC member due to outside contact.6.     Status reports regarding uncompleted Projects which have received grant funds:TAF WETZEL 19A (WILEYVILLE) core drilling this week, after that they will start the roadwork to get the crane up in there. Should be drilling for the foundation soon for the tower. Steel is ordered about 10 weeks out. Steve Yoho 4-19-2022TAF MERCER 20A (PRINCETON) Tower stacked. Electric in process. Awaiting shelter, generator and SIRN site. Bob Hoge 4-19-2022TAF FAYETTE 21A (VALLEY) . We have a meeting next week with Premier to go over the PCD's. Kevin Walker 4-20-2022TAF HARDY 21A (LOST CITY) We have forwarded a copy of the Tower Ground Lease to the owners of the property.  I have met with  Joe Gonzalez  and went over the estimates for the tower.  I am currently in the process of working with Ganoe Communications to see what all Greg had done on the tower before his passing.  I will also be working on getting the frequencies and the information that I need for the Quite Zone.  Hopefully, I can get things started if the weather starts cooperating. Paul R. Lewis 4-19-2022TAF NICHOLAS 21A (9-1-1) finalized our budget and we are going out to bid for the renovations of the new 911 center building, construction should start soon. John McGinnis 4-19-2022TAF CLAY 21A (CLAY) We are currently working on the possibility of moving the tower to the neighboring property. location: Telephonic meeting  Dial-in information: 1-888-273-3658 Participant code: 9045340
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$10,000,000West Virginia Economic Development Authority Dock and Wharf Facilities Revenue Bonds(Empire South Terminal of West Virginia, LLC Project)Series 2022Notice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, June 16, 2022, at 9:00 a.m., at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV  25311, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $10,000,000, which may include refundings thereof, by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority. Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to Empire South Terminal of West Virginia, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, or an affiliate thereof or related person thereto (the Borrower), to finance or refinance the costs of acquiring, constructing, rehabilitating, developing, improving and equipping capital improvements, equipment, land and infrastructure and pay related financing costs with respect to dock and wharf facilities within the meaning of Section 142(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code, located on approximately 24 acres of land at Koppers Road at the Ohio River, Follansbee, West Virginia, including asset acquisition; repair, recertification and repurposing existing storage tanks; design and construction of new hydrogen and petrochemical storage tanks; construction of loading/unloading port stand to support tank farm; construction of pier loading and fueling station; construction of fire suppression and fire support station; relocation of existing utilities; stormwater drainage system improvements; improving road and rail access; demolition of old tanks; improving dock walls and mooring cells; construction of a barge-rail spur; construction of dock-side warehousing and other real and personal property to be constructed and equipped (together, the Project). The initial owner or operator of the Project will be the Borrower. The Borrower proposes to transfer ownership via capital lease to The County Commission of Brooke County, West Virginia (the County), and to re-lease the Project from the County.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower.  Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.  The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the nature and location of Project and the Bonds. To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1-888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Kris Warner, Executive Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on June 16, 2022.  This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.West Virginia Economic Development Authority

location: West Virginia Bureau for Public Health, Environmental Engineering Division, 350 Capitol Street, Room 345, Charleston, WV
purpose: The Bureau for Public Health, Office of Environmental Health Services, will hold a public meeting on July 1,2022 from 3:00 p.m. to 4:00 p.m. to accept written or oral comments on the proposed July 1,2022 through June 30,2023 Draft Intended Use Plan (IUP) for the West Virginia Drinking Water State Revolving Fund program, including the construction loan fund.  The meeting will be held at the West Virginia Bureau for Public Health, Environmental Engineering Division, 350 Capitol Street, Room 345, Charleston, WV and is open to the public. A virtual public meeting option is also provided below at the same date and time.Google Meet Link: https://meet.google.com/qqd-bhqm-hfw?hs=224Telephone Conference:  (US) +1 234-719-4037 (PIN: 439344826)A copy of the proposed IUP will be available for public review on or before June 3,2022 at the following locations:Charleston Central Office(304) 356-4301Wheeling District Office(304) 238-1145Fairmont District Office(304) 368-2530Kearneysville District Office(304) 725-9453Beckley District Office(304) 256-6666St. Albans District Office(304) 722-0611A copy of the proposed IUP will also be available for public review on the Bureau for Public Health website at https://oehs.wvdhhr.org/eed/infrastructure-capacity-development/west-virginia-drinking-water-treatment-revolving-fund-dwtrf/The public may submit written comments by mail, e-mail, facsimile (304-558-0691) or other delivery to:Meredith VanceBureau for Public HealthOffice of Environmental Health ServicesEnvironmental Engineering Division350 Capitol Street, Room 313Charleston, WV 25301-3713Email: meredith.j.vance@wv.gov All comments must be received by 12:00 noon, July 8, 2022.Please include your name, return address, e-mail address, daytime telephone number and indicate any organization that you may represent.  Prior to any final action on this IUP, the Bureau for Public Health will address only comments relevant to IUP issues.

purpose: To consider and act upon all matters that may properly come before a regular meeting of the Parkways Authority Board. These matters may include discussion of and possible Board action on the following: Approval of the minutes of the June 29, 2022, Board Meeting; Discussion of and possible vote for HNTB Corporation to design the following projects: 1) BDR-1-24  Bridge Deck Replacement -  Skitter Creek Bridge SB, 2) BDR-2-24  Bridge Deck Replacement   Skitter Creek Bridge NB and 3) 2C-23  Culvert Cleaning Project  Various Locations on the Turnpike; Discussion of status of the Lease and Operation Agreement between WVPA and Areas USA WVTP, LLC and possible approval of and authorization for the Executive Director to sign the Agreement; Discussion and/or possible approval of the following purchases: 1) Labor and materials to remove and install fencing at Bluestone Travel Plaza Sewage Treatment Plant, 2) Labor and materials for the installation and removal of nine (9) commercial garage doors and openers at Beckley Maintenance, 3) One (1) Natural gas standby generator for Beckley West Maintenance, 4) Two (2) Standard utility bodies for utility shop, 5) Five (5)  Digital Speed Limit Trailers, 6) 12 Extruded Aluminum Sign Panels, 7) One (1)  Landoll Trailer, 8) Heavy Duty Mobile Lifting System, and 9) Roadway and Facility Sign Sheeting and Materials  Contract Renewal; Discussion and/or approval of the following contracts: 1) BDR-3-22  Bridge Deck Replacement  Bridge 3019S, 2) MB-1-22  Median Barrier Replacement at Mile Post 64.0, and 3) BP-1-22  Yeager Bridge Painting  Change Order No. 1; Election of certain officers of the Authority is scheduled for the next regular meeting. The officer positions to be filled are as follows: Vice Chair, Secretary and Treasurer, and any other items which may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-926-1900 or at the website www.wvturnpike.com; items of business may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of the meeting.  The Authority reserves the right to go into Executive Session for appropriate and lawful reasons upon proper motion and vote.

location: 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311
purpose: NOTICE TO RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIAAND OTHER PERSONS INTERESTED - ISSUANCE BY THE WEST VIRGINIA ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF ITS SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY REVENUE BONDS (WYOMING COUNTY COAL PROJECT), SERIES 2022NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN, pursuant to Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, that THE WEST VIRGINIA ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY (the Authority) contemplates the adoption of a bond authorizing resolution, at a regular meeting to be held on August 18, 2022, at 11:00 a.m., prevailing time, to consider for approval the issuance of its Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Wyoming County Coal LLC Project), Series 2022 in an amount not to exceed $45,000,000 (the 2022 Bonds), pursuant to Chapter 31, Article 15 of the West Virginia Code of 1931, as amended, to assist Wyoming County Coal LLC, an Indiana limited liability company (the Company), by issuing its exempt facility bonds for solid waste disposal facilities as defined in Section 142(a)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, to finance the costs of the acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and equipping of solid waste disposal facilities which will be located in Wyoming County, West Virginia and utilized with respect to an existing coal mine and related facilities which will produce an estimated 702,480 tons of premium, High-Vol A coking coal annually for sale primarily into the growing global marketplace, to pay certain capitalized interest on the 2022 Bonds and to pay certain costs of issuing the 2022 Bonds (collectively, the Project). The Project is located generally at 1524 Route 85, Kopperston Road, Oceana, Wyoming County, West Virginia 24870 in census tract 54109002902. The Company will be the owner and the principal user of the Project.  The 2022 Bonds shall be titled the West Virginia Economic Development Authority, Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Wyoming County Coal LLC Project), Series 2022.  The Company has engaged Hilltop Securities to act as underwriter with respect to the 2022 Bonds.  The Company expects the 2022 Bonds to be marketed by September 30, 2022.The Authority shall have no financial obligation or liability of any kind in connection with payment of the principal of or interest on the 2022 Bonds.  The 2022 Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority, but shall be a limited obligation of the Authority payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into among the Authority and the Company and neither the 2022 Bonds nor the interest thereon, nor any charge in connection therewith, shall be a charge against the general credit or taxing powers of the Authority or the State of West Virginia, nor shall the same ever constitute an indebtedness of the Authority or the State of West Virginia, within the meaning of any constitutional provision or statutory limitations.In order to promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, a public hearing will be held before the Authority on August 18, 2022, at 9:00 a.m. solely via the following toll-free telephonic conference line in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing:Those wishing to participate may call Dial in Number:  1-888-273-3658, Access Code: 9045340Any person or persons interested may appear before the Authority, via the teleconference line only, to present oral comments and suggestions and be heard as to the proposed issuance of 2022 Bonds and the location and nature of the Project to be financed with the 2022 Bonds. Interested individuals may also submit written comments to the Authority at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, West Virginia 25311 or to kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on August 18, 2022. This notice is given pursuant to Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.Following said public hearing and at its regularly scheduled meeting at 11:00 a.m. on August 18, 2022, the Authority intends to vote on the adoption of the Resolution approving the issuance of its West Virginia Economic Development Authority, Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Wyoming County Coal LLC Project), Series 2022 and to take such other action as it deems proper.Dated this August 2, 2022./s/ Matthew IrbySecretary, West Virginia Economic Development Authority

Potential strategic initiatives relating to academic and administrative priorities; personnel matters; corporate collaborations and financial matters relating to public private partnerships; the purchase, sale or lease of property; and other deliberative matters involving commercial competition which, if made public, might adversely affect the financial or other interest of the University; and b. Confidential and privileged report by General Counsel; 6. Discussions Emanating from Executive Session  if any; 7. Academic Affairs Updates; 8. Proposed Final Amended Rules and Official Comments Summary for the following: West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.1  Administration & Employment Practices, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.2  Affirmative Action and Equal Employment Opportunity, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.3  Classification & Compensation, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.4  Drug and Alcohol Testing for FTA & FMCSA Covered Positions, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.5  Employee Leave, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.6  Holidays, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.7  Annual Increment, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.8  Performance Management, West Virginia University Board of Governors Talent & Culture Rule 3.9  Reduction in Force, and West Virginia University Board of Governors Finance & Administration Rule 5.8  Travel; 9. Second Notice of Proposed Rulemaking for amendments to the following: West Virginia University Board of Governors Governance Rule 1.4  Ethics, Conflicts of Interest, and Outside Consulting Arrangements; 10. Approval of minutes for June 24, 2022 Regular Board Meeting; 11. Committee Reports For: September 8, 2022 - Joint Finance and Facilities and Revitalization/Strategic Plans and Initiatives Committee Meeting - including: a. Non-Academic Related Transformation (Information Only), b. Approval of The West Virginia Higher Education Funding Formula: WVU Selected Weighted Criteria , c. Approval of Capital Projects Update and Approvals (All listed under Consent Agenda), d. Approval of Resolution Authorizing the Amendment of the Board of Governors existing Bond Indenture, and e. Approval of Amending the Authorizing Resolution of the West Virginia University Board of Governors to increase the amount authorized for the financing of the design, acquisition, construction and equipping of certain capital improvements on the campuses of West Virginia University; and reimbursement of capital improvement costs incurred prior to expected issuance of financing bonds.; September 8, 2022 - Audit Committee Meeting;  and September 8, 2022 - Academic Affairs and Accreditation Committee Meeting; 12. Presidents Report ; 13.  Information Items (Written Only) including a. Board Approved Capital Projects Update, b. Report of Real Property Transactions  Fourth Quarter of FY 2022; c. Educational Materials Report, and d. Organizational (Departmental) Change at West Virginia University School of Medicine; 14. Consent Agenda (for Board Review and Action) including a. Entry of Institutional Undergraduate Fee Waivers and Institutional Graduate and Professional Fee Waivers, b. Termination of the Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in Communication Sciences and Disorders within the School of Medicine, c. Termination of the Master of Public Health (MPHG) in Health Policy degree program within the School of Public Health, d. Approval of New Program:  BMDS in Teaching in STEM in the Eberly College of Arts and Sciences, e. Student Recreation Fields Turf Replacement, f. Chitwood Hall Renovation, g. Renaming of Buildings, h. Jacksons Mill Sewer and Water Improvements, i. Real Estate Transaction  Research Park, and j. Approval of BOG Committee Assignments and Reappointments; 15. Other Business and General Discussion; 16. The next regular board meeting is scheduled for November 11, 2022; and 17. Adjournment       Other items may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-293-2562 or at the website: http://bog.wvu.edu/ - items of interest may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of meeting.

location: Telephonic meeting Dial-in information: 1-888-273-3658 Participant code: 9045340
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$40,000,000West Virginia Economic Development Authority Solid Waste Disposal Facilities Revenue Bonds(Empire Green Generation, LLC Project)Series 2022Notice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, October 20, 2022, at 9:00 a.m., at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV  25311, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $40,000,000 by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority. The Bonds may be refunded in the future.  Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to Empire Green Generation, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, or an affiliate thereof or related person thereto (the Borrower), to finance or refinance the costs of acquiring, constructing, rehabilitating, developing, improving and equipping capital improvements, equipment, land and infrastructure and pay related financing costs with respect to solid waste disposal facilities within the meaning of Section 142(a)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code, located on approximately 13 acres of land at Koppers Road at the Ohio River, Follansbee, West Virginia, including the deployment of a 70 ton per day thermochemical medical waste recycling system to generate electricity, together with other real and personal property to be constructed and equipped (together, the Project). The initial owner or operator of the Project will be the Borrower.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower.  Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.  The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the nature and location of Project and the Bonds. To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1-888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Kris Warner, Executive Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on October 20, 2022.  This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.West Virginia Economic Development Authority

purpose: Facts and circumstances of the emergency required by W. Va. Code ยง 6-9A-3(h):Pursuant to W. Va. Code ยง 6-9A-2(2)(C), an emergency meeting is required to avoid imminent substantial harm to a public agency or members of the public served by the Secretary of State as the states chief election official following the expected Final Order of the Kanawha County Circuit Court to effectuate the anticipated Court's ruling in State ex rel. Anderson v. Warner, et al., which hearing to show cause is scheduled for October 19, 2022, at 1:30pm. Before the Court is an eligibility challenge of a Senate candidate. If the Court declares the candidate ineligible, remedies may include a direction to the Secretary to issue an order to the affected counties including but not limiting to refraining from counting any votes cast for the ineligible candidate, reprograming voting machines, correcting absentee ballots, issuing corrected absentee ballots, posting signs on polling place doors notifying the voters of the disqualification, or a combination thereof. The Secretary's order-issuance authority in W. Va. Code ยง 3-1A-6(a) requires prior consultation with the State Election Commission. With election day scheduled for November 8, 2022, this emergency meeting is to meet that consultation requirement at the earliest opportunity.

agency: West Virginia Economic Development AuthorityDepartment of Commerce
location: 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311
purpose: NOTICE TO RESIDENTS OF THE STATE OF WEST VIRGINIAAND OTHER PERSONS INTERESTED - ISSUANCE BY THE WEST VIRGINIA ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY OF ITS SOLID WASTE DISPOSAL FACILITY REVENUE BONDS (SUNDIAL MINING PROJECT), SERIES 2022ANOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN, pursuant to Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, that THE WEST VIRGINIA ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY (the Authority) contemplates the adoption of a bond authorizing resolution, at a special meeting to be held on December 8, 2022, at 11:00 a.m., prevailing time, to consider for approval the issuance of its Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022A in an amount not to exceed $48,591,675 (the 2022A Bonds), pursuant to Chapter 31, Article 15 of the West Virginia Code of 1931, as amended, to assist Sundial Mining LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (the Company), by issuing its exempt facility bonds for solid waste disposal facilities as defined in Section 142(a)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, to finance the costs of the acquisition, construction, reconstruction, and equipping of solid waste disposal facilities which will be located in Raleigh County, West Virginia and utilized with respect to an existing coal mine and related facilities which will produce an estimated 200,000 tons of premium, High-Vol A coking coal and 200,000 tons of thermal coal annually for sale primarily into the growing global marketplace, to fund a reserve fund for the 2022A Bonds and to pay certain costs of issuing the 2022A Bonds (collectively, the Project). The Project is located generally at 8641 Coal River Road, Naoma, Raleigh County, West Virginia. The Company will be the owner and the principal user of the Project.  The 2022A Bonds shall be titled the West Virginia Economic Development Authority, Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022A.  The Company has engaged Piper Sandler & Co. to act as underwriter with respect to the 2022A Bonds.  The Company expects the 2022A Bonds to be marketed by March 31, 2023.  In addition to the issuance of 2022A Bonds the Authority also expects to issue its Taxable Industrial Facility Revenue Bonds (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022B (the 2022B Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount which when combined with the aggregate principal amount of the 2022A Bonds will not exceed $50,000,000.   The Authority shall have no financial obligation or liability of any kind in connection with payment of the principal of or interest on the 2022A Bonds.  The 2022A Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority, but shall be a limited obligation of the Authority payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into among the Authority and the Company and neither the 2022A Bonds nor the interest thereon, nor any charge in connection therewith, shall be a charge against the general credit or taxing powers of the Authority or the State of West Virginia, nor shall the same ever constitute an indebtedness of the Authority or the State of West Virginia, within the meaning of any constitutional provision or statutory limitations.In order to promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, a public hearing will be held before the Authority on November 18, 2022, at 9:00 a.m. solely via the following toll-free telephonic conference line in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing:Those wishing to participate may call Dial in Number:  1-888-273-3658Access Code: 9045340Any person or persons interested may appear before the Authority, via the teleconference line only, to present oral comments and suggestions and be heard as to the proposed issuance of 2022A Bonds and the location and nature of the Project to be financed with the 2022A Bonds. Interested individuals may also submit written comments to the Authority at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, West Virginia 25311 or to caren.d.wilcher@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on December 8, 2022. This notice is given pursuant to Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.Following said public hearing and at its special scheduled meeting at 11:00 a.m. on December 8, 2022, the Authority intends to vote on the adoption of the Resolution approving the issuance of its West Virginia Economic Development Authority, Solid Waste Disposal Facility Revenue Bonds (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022A and to take such other action as it deems proper.Dated this December 1, 2022./s/ Matthew IrbySecretary, West Virginia Economic Development Authority

location: Telephonic meeting Dial-in information: 1-888-273-3658 Participant code: 9045340
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$193,885,650West Virginia Economic Development Authority Solid Waste Disposal Facilities Revenue Bonds(Jefferson Metals Recovery, LLC Project)Notice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, December 15, 2022, at 9:00 a.m., at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV  25311, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $193,885,650 by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority. The Bonds may be refunded in the future.  Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to Jefferson Metals Recovery, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of Jefferson Metals Holdings, LLC, or an affiliate thereof or related person thereto (the Borrower), to finance or refinance the costs of acquiring, constructing, rehabilitating, developing, improving and equipping capital improvements, equipment, land and infrastructure and pay related financing costs with respect to solid waste disposal facilities within the meaning of Section 142(a)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code, located on approximately 20 acres of land along State Route 2 at the Ohio River, Follansbee, West Virginia, including the construction of a blast furnace and a mini sinter plant all for the manufacture of pig iron sourced from slag material with iron properties and iron-ore tailings/fines, together with other real and personal property to be constructed and equipped (together, the Project). The initial owner or operator of the Project will be the Borrower.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower.  Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.  The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the nature and location of Project and the Bonds. To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1-888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Kris Warner, Executive Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on December 15, 2022.  This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.West Virginia Economic Development Authority

location: VIA CONFERENCE BRIDGE To reserve time to address the WV WTAAFRC contact ROBERT HOGE, CHAIR 304.425.4911 Option 4 Mercer911@citlink.net
purpose: THIS IS THE REGULAR MONTHLY MEETING OF THE TAAFRC. The agenda is belowAGENDA FOR 1-31-2023 TOWER ACCESS ASSISTANCE FUND REVIEW COMMITTEE MEETING1.Roll call and determination of whether a voting quorum is present.2.Approval of minutes of previous meeting.  October 25, 2022  No meeting in November3. Financial report.4.Media items, if any. 5- WTAAF matters dealt with by any TAAFRC member due to outside contact.6.     Status reports regarding uncompleted Projects which have received grant funds:TAF WETZEL 19A (WILEYVILLE)    TAF FAYETTE 21A (VALLEY) . All studies are done including FAA.  Haven't talked to Marion this week to what else is going on other than demo of the old site. Phillip Pack 11-15-2022TAF HARDY 21A (LOST CITY) we have ordered the steel for the tower and am getting pricing for the SIRN equipment and the other equipment that I need for the tower.  The road and pad are completed as well as the survey and they are also working on the environmental study and the frequencies that we need. Paul Lewis 1-11-2023TAF NICHOLAS 21A (9-1-1) TAF CLAY 21A (CLAY) Mead & Hunt are a couple weeks away from having everything finalized on their end.  The commission voted to accept Mercer County Menu bid with Premier Construction, and the tower has already been ordered from Allstate Tower(10-12 week lead time).  Things seem to be moving right along,  we expect to start breaking ground on the new road and construction site by March.  We are kind of at the mercy of the weather at this point.  David Schoolcraft 1-11-2023 TAF GRANT 22B (BAYARD) TAF CABELL 22A (BARBOURSVILLE)Additional items as appropriate.Applications for consideration 7.Next meeting will be held at 10:00 a.m., in the small first floor hearing room of the WVPSC Building (201 Brooks Street, Charleston, WV) and conference bridge on February 28, 20238.Order and/or subject matter of agenda items may change during the meeting.2022 MEETINGS: (Last Tuesday of Month, except December), , March 28, 2023, April 25, 2023, May 30 2023, June 27, 2023, July 25, 2023, August 29, 2023, September 26, 2023, October 31, 2023, November 28, 2023, December 12, 2023

The Town of Pax now services and sells water to about 300 customers.; 2) Limited License Agreement revocable at will after 30-day notice for Beautification, Agricultural, and Similar Purposes Near Collinsdale/Whittaker, Valley District, Fayette County, West Virginia, and, 3) Renewal of Tamaracks Executive Directors Employment Contract; Discussion and/or approval of the following contracts: 1) 1A-23  Pavement Rehabilitation; 2) BP-2-23  Bridge Painting  Bridge 3044N at Milepost 51.43; 3) TC-1-23  Tree Cutting Contract  Change Order, and 4) TRR-1-23  Tamarack Restroom Renovation  Supplemental Agreement, and, any other items which may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-926-1900 or at the website www.wvturnpike.com; items of business may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of the meeting. location: Telephonic meeting Dial -in information: 1-888-273-3658 Participant code: 9045340
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$300,000,000West Virginia Economic Development Authority Solid Waste Disposal Facilities Revenue Bonds(Jefferson Metals Recovery, LLC Project)Notice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, February 2, 2023, at 9:00 a.m., at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV  25311, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $300,000,000 by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority. A portion of the Bonds are expected to be issued, initially, as bond anticipation notes which will thereafter be refunded by long-term bonds.  Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to Jefferson Metals Recovery, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of Jefferson Metals Holdings, LLC, or an affiliate thereof or related person thereto (the Borrower), to finance or refinance the costs of acquiring, constructing, rehabilitating, developing, improving and equipping capital improvements, equipment, land and infrastructure and pay related financing costs with respect to solid waste disposal facilities within the meaning of Section 142(a)(6) of the Internal Revenue Code, consisting of the construction of a blast furnace and a mini sinter plant all for the manufacture of pig iron sourced from, among other materials, slag material with iron properties and iron-ore tailings/fines, and including areas for temporary location of materials to be processed or final products, together with other real and personal property to be constructed and equipped (together, the Project). The Project will be located on sites consisting of approximately 37 acres along State Route 2 and Veterans Drive in Follansbee, West Virginia, and/or approximately 187 acres in Brooke County, near Follansbee, West Virginia, located between Archer Hill Road and Mahan Lane, the western edge of which is located approximately eight-tenths miles east of State Route 2 and the eastern edge is approximately nine-tenths of a mile west of Brooke County Road 10. The initial owner or operator of the Project will be the Borrower.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower.  Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.  The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the nature and location of Project and the Bonds. To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1-888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Kris Warner, Executive Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on February 2, 2023.  This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.West Virginia Economic Development Authority

Consideration of a Resolution to enter into a lease agreement with BHE Renewables, LLC for the portion of the space currently occupied by Thrasher.3. purpose: The WV Early Intervention Interagency Coordinating Council will meet for its next regular meeting: Wednesday, March 15, 2023Summersville Arena and Conference Center3 Armory WaySummersville, WV 26651 with a virtual option via Zoom.The meeting is scheduled to begin at 9:30 am and will end at 3:30 pm. The agenda for this meeting is posted on the ICC website  http://www.wveiicc.org/schedule_of_events. The Council, mandated by Part C of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA), is to advise and assist the WV Department of Health and Human Resources in the implementation of the WV Birth to Three System.  Interested persons are invited to attend.  For anyone needing special accommodations, information, or agenda copies, please contact Sheila Zickefoose, Council Director, five days prior to the meeting to coordinate arrangements.

purpose: MEETING NOTICEWEST VIRGINIA HOSPITAL FINANCE AUTHORITYSPECIAL BOARD MEETINGMARCH 9, 2023Notice is hereby given that the West Virginia Hospital Finance Authority (theAuthority) will conduct a special meeting on Thursday, March 9, 2023, at 12:00 noon inConference Room 4Q at the law offices of Bowles Rice LLP, 600 Quarrier Street, Charleston,West Virginia. Members of the public may join the meeting in person by attending at the timeand place noted above or contact Camden P. Siegrist at (304) 347-1129 for information to jointhe meeting by Zoom.The purposes for which this meeting is being held and the agenda for the meetingwill include the following items:1. Call to Order.2. Reading and Approval of Minutes of prior meeting(s) (if needed).3. Consideration of and action on a proposed Resolution approving theissuance by the Authority of its Hospital Revenue Bonds (Vandalia Health Group) 2023 Series A(Taxable) (the 2023 A Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $100,000,000,the proceeds of which will be loaned to Charleston Area Medical Center, Inc., a West Virginianonprofit corporation, as group agent (the Group Agent) on behalf of the Vandalia HealthGroup, consisting of the Group Agent, CAMC Foundation, Inc. (the Foundation), MonongaliaHealth System, Inc. (MHS), Monongalia County General Hospital Company (Mon General),Mon Elder Services (Mon Elder), Stonewall Jackson Memorial Hospital Company(Stonewall), CAMC Greenbrier Valley Medical Center, Inc. (CAMC GVMC), and CAMCPlateau Medical Center, Inc. (CAMC PMC, and collectively with the Group Agent,Foundation, MHS, Mon General, Mon Elder, Stonewall, and CAMC GVMC, the Group), andused by the Group, together with other available funds, to: (i) pay and/or reimburse the costs ofthe acquisition by CAMC PMC of substantially all of the assets of Oak Hill Hospital Corporationand Oak Hill Clinic Corp., each a West Virginia corporation, which directly or indirectly ownand operate Plateau Medical Center (the Hospital) in Oak Hill, West Virginia, together withcertain related businesses including medical office buildings, outpatient care facilities, physicianpractices and ancillary services and costs associated therewith; (ii) pay, finance, refinance orreimburse capital expenditures approved in any Vandalia Health capital budget for hospital andother health care improvements and facilities, as amended from time to time, including, withoutlimitation, capital expenditures at the Hospital campus in Oak Hill, West Virginia; and (iii) paycosts of issuing the 2023 A Bonds.4. Update and possible action on new office space for Authority in theGreenbrooke Building, 1124 Smith Street, Charleston, West Virginia.15510947.15. Discussion of and possible action on retirement of Sarah B. Hamrick andfilling of vacancy created by such retirement, including without limitation the hiring of a newemployee or entering into another arrangement with a person to fill such vacancy.6. Discussion of and possible action on budgetary matters.7. Update on Performance Review.8. Discussion of possible upcoming bond issues of the Authority.

location: Tamarack Conference Center One Tamarack Park Beckley, WV 25801
purpose: To consider and act upon all matters that may properly come before a regular meeting of the Parkways Authority Board. These matters may include discussion of and possible Board action on the following: Approval of the minutes of the February 23, 2023, Board Meeting; Discussion and/or approval for HNTB to design the following projects:  1) BW-1-24  Barrier Wall near Yeager Bridge, Kanawha City, Charleston, WV; 2) BSR-1-24  Shotcrete Repairs at various bridges along the WV Turnpike; 3) 1A-24  Pavement rehabilitation in the form of HMA mill and inlay at various locations along the Turnpike; Discussion and/or approval of the following: Presentation of the West Virginia Parkways Authority Semi-Annual Investment Report dated December 31, 2022 by Truist Advisory Services; Discussion and/or approval of the following: Beckley & Bluestone Travel Plazas - The parties, to the effort to demolition and reconstruction of the Beckley and Bluestone travel Plazas, are in the process of formulating a contract. At this time, it would be appropriate for the Authority to vote to authorize the Executive Director to execute a satisfactory contract once approved by General Counsel and HNTB.  Discussion and/or approval of the following contracts: 1) 2A-23  Pavement Rehabilitation  Various Locations along the Turnpike; 2) BDR-1-23 & BDR-3-23  Bridge Deck Replacement for Bridges 3003N and 3005N on the WV Turnpike; Discussion and/or approval of the following items:  Seasonal Agricultural Lease Agreement, revocable at will, with 30 days notice, for certain  property near Tamarack, and, any other items which may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-926-1900 or at the website www.wvturnpike.com; items of business may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of the meeting.  The Authority reserves the right to go into Executive Session for appropriate and lawful reasons upon proper motion and vote.

agency: Board of the West Virginia Economic Development AuthorityWest Virginia Economic Development Authority
location: Main Conference Room of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority, NorthGate Business Park, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV or via teleconference, due to COVID-19 pandemic, Toll-Free Dial is Number 1-888-273-3658, Access Code: 9045340#
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$90,000,000West Virginia Economic Development AuthorityUniversity Facilities Revenue Refunding Bonds(Provident Group  Marshall Properties L.L.C.  Marshall University Project)Series 2023A and Series 2023BNotice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, April 20, 2023, at 9:00 a.m., at NorthGate Business Park, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, West Virginia 25311 or in compliance with IRS Rev. Proc. 2022-20, via teleconference, due to COVID-19 pandemic, Toll-Free Dial in Number 1-888-273-3658, Access Code: 9045340#, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $90,000,000 by the Authority. Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned by the Authority to Provident Group  Marshall Properties L.L.C., a West Virginia limited liability company (the Borrower), whose sole member is Provident Resources Group Inc., a Georgia nonprofit corporation and an organization exempt from federal income tax under Section 501(a) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended (the Code), as an organization described under Section 501(c)(3) of the Code, to finance or refinance the costs of (a) the current refunding of the Cabell County, West Virginia Variable Rate Demand University Facilities Revenue Bonds (Provident Group  Marshall Properties L.L.C.  Marshall University Project) Series 2010 (the Series 2010A Bonds) and Cabell County, West Virginia Subordinate University Facilities Revenue Bonds (Provident Group  Marshall Properties L.L.C.  Marshall University Project) Series 2010B (the Series 2010B Bonds, and together with the Series 2010A Bonds, the Series 2010 Bonds), previously issued to finance the Borrowers acquisition of an approximately 812-bed student housing facility and an approximately 123,850 square foot student recreation/wellness center (collectively, the Facilities), located on the campus of Marshall University (the University), (b) paying a termination payment associated with terminating an existing swap agreement related to the Series 2010 Bonds, (c) paying the University a Facilities support fee; and (d) paying the costs of issuing the Series 2023 Bonds (collectively, the Project). The Facilities are located at the corner of 5th Avenue and 20th Street in Huntington, West Virginia. The initial owner and principal user of the Facilities will be the Borrower. The Bonds are expected to be qualified 501(c)(3) bonds as defined in Section 145 of the Code.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower. Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the plan of finance, the nature and location of the Facilities and the Bonds. In compliance with IRS Rev. Proc. 2022-20, to promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1 888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340#. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Kris Warner, Executive Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail kris.e.warner@wv.gov on or before 9:00 a.m. on April 20, 2023. This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Code.

location: Telephonic meeting Dial-in information:  1-888-273-3658 Participant Code: 9045340
purpose: NOTICE OF PUBLIC HEARING$50,000,000West Virginia Economic Development Authority, Dock and Wharf Facilities Revenue Bonds (Empire South Terminal of West Virginia, LLC Project), Series 2023Notice is hereby given of a public hearing to be held on behalf of the West Virginia Economic Development Authority (the Authority), on Thursday, April 20, 2023, at 9:30 a.m., at 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV  25311, with respect to the issuance from time to time as a plan of finance of one or more series of bonds (the Bonds) in an aggregate principal amount not to exceed $50,000,000, which may include refundings thereof, by the West Virginia Economic Development Authority. Proceeds of the Bonds will be loaned to Empire South Terminal of West Virginia, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, or an affiliate thereof or related person thereto (the Borrower), to finance or refinance the costs of acquiring, constructing, rehabilitating, developing, improving and equipping capital improvements, equipment, land and infrastructure and pay related financing costs with respect to dock and wharf facilities within the meaning of Section 142(a)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code, located on approximately 24 acres of land at Koppers Road at the Ohio River, Follansbee, West Virginia, including asset acquisition; repair, recertification and repurposing existing storage tanks; design and construction of new hydrogen and petrochemical storage tanks; construction of loading/unloading port stand to support tank farm; construction of pier loading and fueling station; construction of fire suppression and fire support station; relocation of existing utilities; stormwater drainage system improvements; improving road and rail access; demolition of old tanks; improving dock walls and mooring cells; construction of a barge-rail spur; construction of dock-side warehousing and other real and personal property to be constructed and equipped (together, the Project). The initial owner or operator of the Project will be the Borrower. The Borrower proposes to transfer ownership of the Project via capital lease to The County Commission of Brooke County, West Virginia (the County), and to re-lease the Project from the County.The Bonds shall not constitute an indebtedness of the Authority but shall be limited obligations of the Authority, payable solely from loan repayment proceeds or other revenues to be derived pursuant to a loan agreement to be entered into between the Authority and the Borrower.  Neither the Bonds nor the interest thereon shall constitute a debt or pledge of the faith and credit or taxing authority of the State of West Virginia or of any county, municipality or any other political subdivision thereof.  The public hearing will be conducted by the Executive Director of the Authority. All interested persons are invited to attend such public hearing to express their views with respect to the nature and location of Project and the Bonds. To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, in lieu of physical presence at the public hearing, attendance will be solely by telephone. All those wishing to participate may call-in by toll free number at 1-888-273-3658, Participant Code: 9045340. Interested persons may submit their views in writing, or questions or requests for additional information may be directed, to Caren Wilcher, Associate Director, West Virginia Economic Development Authority, 180 Association Drive, Charleston, WV 25311 or e-mail caren.d.wilcher@wv.gov on or before 9:30 a.m. on April 20, 2023.  This notice is published and the hearing is to be held in satisfaction of the requirements of Section 147(f) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended.West Virginia Economic Development Authority

Medical Center, a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Berkeley Medical), (iv) University Healthcare Foundation, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (UHF), (v) The Charles Town General Hospital d/b/a Jefferson Medical Center, a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Jefferson Medical), (vi) United Hospital Center, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (UHC), (vii) Camden-Clark Memorial Hospital Corporation d/b/a CamdenClark Medical Center, a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (CCMC), (viii) Barnesville Hospital Association, Inc., an Ohio nonprofit corporation (Barnesville), (ix) Braxton County Memorial Hospital, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Braxton), (x) Community Health Association d/b/a Jackson General Hospital, a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Jackson General), (xi) Potomac Valley Hospital of W. Va., Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (PVH), (xii) Reynolds Memorial Hospital, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Reynolds), (xiii) St. Josephs Hospital of Buckhannon, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (St. Josephs), (xiv) The West Virginia Health Care Cooperative, Inc. d/b/a Summersville Regional Medical Center, a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Summersville), (xv) Uniontown Hospital, a Pennsylvania nonprofit corporation (Uniontown), and (xvi) Wetzel County Hospital, Inc., a West Virginia nonprofit corporation (Wetzel) (each a Member, and collectively, the Obligated Group); and used to finance (a) on behalf of WVUH, (i) the construction, renovation, expansion and equipping of improvements to the second, fourth and sixth floors of J.W. Ruby Memorial Hospital, including but not limited to adding additional adult beds, the expansion of operating room services, adding additional physician office space, increasing loading docks and supply chain space and adding additional endoscopy rooms, PACU beds and pre- and post-operation bays at the hospital campus located at 1 Medical Center Drive, Morgantown, West Virginia and the construction and equipping of a new outpatient physical therapy medical office building located adjacent to 6040 University Town Centre Drive, Morgantown, West Virginia, in a principal amount not to exceed $175,000,000; and (ii) the construction, renovation, expansion and equipping of improvements to Fairmont Medical Center located at 1325 Locust Avenue, Fairmont, West Virginia in a principal amount not to exceed $70,000,000; (b) on behalf of Jackson General, the construction, development and equipping of a two-story addition to Jackson Generals hospital facilities which will include, without limitation, a new emergency department with 14 private rooms, a surgical department with 12 pre- and post-anesthesia bays, two operating suites and two procedure rooms and a second floor serving as an inpatient/swing bed floor with 18 private rooms for the hospital campus located at 122 Pinnell Street, Ripley, West Virginia in a principal amount not to exceed $35,000,000; (c) capitalized interest on the Bonds; and (d) the costs of issuing the Bonds.All of such uses are permitted by Chapter 16, Article 29A of the Code of West Virginia, 1931, as amended (the Act), and one or more loan agreements to be executed by the Issuer and the Obligated Group Agent.The Bonds will be special obligations of the Issuer and pursuant to the Act, will not constitute a debt or a pledge of the faith and credit of the Issuer or a pledge of the faith and credit or taxing power of the State of West Virginia or any political subdivision thereof.  Persons wishing to express their views on the proposed issuance of the Bonds may appear at the hearing or may submit their views in writing regarding the proposed issuance of the Bonds and the nature of the projects to be financed therewith.  Any written submissions should be sent to the West Virginia Hospital Finance Authority, 1124 Smith Street, Suite B100B, Charleston, WV 25301, Attention:  Chairman, and clearly marked Re: West Virginia Hospital Finance Authoritys Hospital Revenue Bonds (West Virginia University Health System Obligated Group), 2023 Series.  Written submissions should be mailed in sufficient time to be received before April 20, 2023.The State of West Virginia acting by and through the West Virginia Hospital Finance Authority, James R. Christie, Chairman.

subagency: West Virginia Dept of Economic Development Weaterization
location: 1900 Kanawha Blvd., E Charleston, WV 25305 Building 3
purpose: PY 2023-2024 WV WEATHERIZATION ASSISTANCE PROGRAMState PlanPUBLIC HEARING NOTICE: The Community Advancement and Development (CAD) division of the West Virginia Department of Economic Development (WVDED) is hosting an online public hearing on the proposed use and distribution of funds for the Weatherization Assistance Program funded by the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) on Friday, April 28, 2023 at 10:00AM. The WVDED is seeking comments from the public on the proposed use of funds. The plan will guide the expenditure of approximately $4,325,662 annual funding for PY 2023-2024 beginning July 1, 2023. The draft plan is available for public review until close of business Friday, April 28, 2023 and will be submitted to the DOE on or about May 1, 2023. Additional information about the plan and hearing are available on the CAD divisions website, including the draft plan and instructions for registering to attend the online hearing. To visit the website enter the following into your internet browser without spaces: www.wvcad.org/sustainability/weatherization-assistance-program. To be considered in the plan written comments will be received in the WVDED at 1900 Kanawha Blvd.,East, Building 3, Suite 700, Charleston, WV 25305, attention Rebekah Burns, or submitted via email to rebekah.j.burns@wv.gov.

subagency: WVEDA and WVJIT Board of Directors
location: Telephone Meeting Dial in information 1-571-317-3122 Access Code 977-466-181
purpose: Regular monthly meeting. The Board of Directors will also consider and take action on matters including, but not limited to the following:1. Supplement to original Authorizing Resolution dated December 22, 2022 (A) to Authorize the increase of the existing $75 Million initial project incentive by the remaining $215 Million in Economic Development Financial Assistance appropriated to the High Impact Project Fund to support the project; and (B) Authorizing the Chairman or other Designated Officers of the WVEDA to execute and deliver such related documents, certificates, or instruments that such authorized officer deems necessary or desirable in connection therewith; and requiring certain project documents. 2. Supplemental Resolution authorizing a $75,000,000 forgivable performance loan from the Economic Development Project Fund to support Project Kent in Berkeley County, West Virginia, as a High Impact Development Project, to be made to either Commercial Metals Company, a Delaware Corporation, or its Wholly-Owned Subsidiary, CMC Steel US, LLC, a Delaware Limited Liability Company; authorizing the Chairman or other Designated Officers of the Authority to negotiate, execute and deliver all related documents, certificates, or instruments, and to take all other actions that such authorized officer deems necessary or desirable in connection therewith; and requiring the collection of certain project specific information for reporting purposes.3. Motleys Industrial Proposal to conduct an auction of the MRV Beverage LLC bottling equipment located in Rainelle, West Virginia.WVJIT Board Meeting will be held immediately following the WVEDA Board meeting.  To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authoritys staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, public attendance will be virtual.  All of those wishing to participate may call 1-571-317-3122, Access Code 977-466-181 or you may request a video link by calling 304-558-3651.

agency: WV WIRELESS TOWER ACCESS ASSISTANCE FUND REVIEW COMMITTEEWV PUBLIC SERVICE COMMISSION
location: VIA CONFERENCE BRIDGE To reserve time to address the WV WTAAFRC contact ROBERT HOGE, CHAIR 304.425.4911 Option 4 Mercer911@citlink.net
purpose: THIS IS THE REGULAR QUARTERLY MEETING OF THE TAAFRC. The agenda is belowAGENDA FOR 6-27-2023 TOWER ACCESS ASSISTANCE FUND REVIEW COMMITTEE MEETING1.Roll call and determination of whether a voting quorum is present.2.Approval of minutes of previous meeting.  March 28, 20233. Financial report.4.Media items, if any. 5- WTAAF matters dealt with by any TAAFRC member due to outside contact.6.     Status reports regarding uncompleted Projects which have received grant funds:TAF WETZEL 19A (WILEYVILLE)    New generator is in, all foundation work complete, outside grounding in place, they should begin the electrical upgrades and interior grounding soon. Steve Yoho 4-20-2023. meet with Premier Construction Yesterday, we have the first 40 feet of the tower standing and we meet with the crane company and we will have to remove a few more trees and build a pad to park the crane on at the site so that they can stand the rest of the tower, the pad will be built next week and hopefully the week after that they can get the crane in there and stand the rest of the tower. Generator has been installed and they are going to begin the grounding system inside the building in the next couple of weeks. We are looking into a Microwave hop to the Archies Fork Tower as well. Steve Yoho 5-24-2023TAF FAYETTE 21A (VALLEY) . We are at demolition of the old verizon reflector site.  Marion said last week that they will be starting on that next week.  Waiting in line with everyone else. Phillip Pack 5-24-2023TAF HARDY 21A (LOST CITY) , the project is beginning the construction side, site is ready, road is built, power is applied for, tower is ready for delivery FAA and FCC is approved, environmental is approved. Building is ordered. Joe Gonzalez 4-20-2023. Ordering Aviat equipment and digging for under ground electric.  The steel arriving shortly.  Working on the Frequencies. Paul Lewis 5-23-2023TAF NICHOLAS 21A (9-1-1) still on track to open the new center sometime in July John McGinnis 4-20-2023. We are ahead of schedule. Tying up all the loose ends, tentative date for us is July 1. John McGinnis 5-23-2023TAF CLAY 21A (CLAY) We have broken ground.  They are doing dirt work for the pad and access road now. Should be done with that in 2 weeks then Marion will start the foundation for the tower. David Schoolcraft 4-21-2023. dirt work is done.  We will be stating the foundation for the tower in the next few weeks David Schoolcraft 5-24-2023TAF GRANT 22B (BAYARD) On March 28, 2023, the Commission signed with Premier Construction.  It all begins now.  Peggy Alt 4-4-2023. working on environmentals and engineering. We will be ordering steel shortly. Peggy Alt 5-23-2023TAF CABELL 22A (BARBOURSVILLE) The Site layout had to be updated to reduce the amount of dirt needing moved, Site trees and brush were removed to comply with request from the US fish and wildlife service. Steve Vititoe 4-20-2023. Invoice for the first half of the tower steel was sent over to the courthouse for payment. Getting the shelter ordered. Steve Vititoe 2-25-2023Additional items as appropriate. 7.Next meeting will be held at 10:00 a.m., in the small first floor hearing room of the WVPSC Building (201 Brooks Street, Charleston, WV) and conference bridge on June 27, 20238.Order and/or subject matter of agenda items may change during the meeting.2023 MEETINGS: (Last Tuesday of Month, except December),  September 26, 2023, November 28, 2023, December 12, 2023

agency: Mon Power and PEPublic Service Commission
location: Public Service Commission Howard M. Cunningham Hearing Room 201 Brooks Street Charleston, WV 25301
purpose: The topics to be covered include a threshold explanation of whether an integrated utility generally, and MonPower/PE specifically, is considered a "member" for all functions (Generation Owner/Operator, Transmission owner (TO), and Load Serving Entity (LSE), or whether an integrated utility is a member of PJM as a Transmission Owner only;  the benefits and negatives of membership of the utilities in the PJM Interconnection regional transmission organization; costs to the LSE and compensation to the TO of power transmission as either members or non-members of PJM; rights of Generator Owners to sell power in the PJM bid-based competitive markets if they are members or non-members; timing and impacts of a decision to withdraw from PJM membership; and FERC oversight over decisions regarding PJM membership.

location: Public Service Commission Howard M. Cunningham Hearing Room 201 Brooks Street Charleston, WV 25301
purpose: The topics to be covered include a threshold explanation of whether an integrated utility generally, and Appalachian Power Company/Wheeling Power Company specifically, is considered a "member" for all functions (Generation Owner/Operator, Transmission owner (TO), and Load Serving Entity (LSE), or whether an integrated utility is a member of PJM as a Transmission Owner only; the benefits and negatives of membership of the utilities in the PJM Interconnection regional transmission organization; costs to the LSE and compensation to the TO of power transmission as either members or non-members of PJM; rights of Generator Owners to sell power in the PJM bid-based competitive markets if they are members or non-members; timing and impacts of a decision to withdraw from PJM membership; FERC oversight over decisions regarding PJM membership; how the AEP intercompany Transmission Agreement and Power Supply Agreement would allow or be impacted a decision that APCo/WPCo withdraw from PJM; and implications of Virginia State Corporation Commission requirements for APCo if withdrawal from PJM was determined to be reasonable and necessary by the PSC of WV.

location: Telephone Meeting Dial in information 1-571-317-3122 Access Code 977-466-181
purpose: Will hold its annual meeting to elect officers in conjunction with its regular monthly meeting. The Board of Directors will also consider and take action on matter including, but not limited to the following:1. A Resolution amending the bond Authorizing Resolution adopted on December 8, 2022 which authorized and directed the issuance of not more than $50,000,000 combined aggregate principal amount of solid waste disposal facility revenue bonds, (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022A and a taxable industrial facility revenue bonds, (Sundial Mining LLC Project), Series 2022B to increase the maximum principal amount for the bonds to $75,000,000; to change the series designation of such bonds to Series 2023A and Series 2023B, as applicable; to adjust the maximum interest rate and maximum term of the bonds; to adjust the descriptions of the solid waste disposal project and the industrial project and ratifying the bond authorizing the Resolution.2. To consider approval of a resolution to provide up to $62.5mm in forgivable loans for a high impact project related to the production of hydrogen in Mason County, West Virginia.  The WVEAC Annual Board Meeting will be held immediately following the WVEDA Board meeting. The Board of Directors will also consider and take action on matters including, but not limited to the following:1. Election of Directors and OfficersWVJIT Board Meeting will be held immediately following the WVEDC Annual Board meeting.To promote and protect the safety of both the public and the Authority's staff in light of the COVID-19 pandemic, public attendance will be virtual. All of those wishing to participate may call 1-571-317-3122, Access Code 977-466-181 or may request a video link by calling 304-558-3651.

purpose: 1. Call to Order; 2. Potential Executive Session, under authority in West Virginia Code Sections 6-9A-4(b)(2)(A), (b)(9), (b)(10), and (b)(12) to  discuss: a. Potential strategic initiatives relating to academic and administrative priorities; personnel matters; corporate collaborations and financial matters relating to public private partnerships; the purchase, sale or lease of property; and other deliberative matters involving commercial competition which, if made public, might adversely affect the financial or other interest of the University; b. Possible naming opportunity of a non-academic building; and c. Confidential and preliminary matters involving or affecting the Universitys budget for the current and upcoming academic year, including retention and enrollment; 3. Discussions Emanating from Executive Session  if any; 4. Discussion and Vote on Provosts Office Final Recommendations; 5. Fall 2023 Fiscal Leading Indicators (Information Only); 6. Approval of minutes for June 23, 2023, July 31, 2023, and August 22, 2023 board meetings; 7.  Information Items (Written Only) including:  a. Report of Real Property Transactions  Fourth Quarter of FY 2023; b. Educational Materials Report; c. Organizational (Departmental) Change at the West Virginia University School of Medicine: The WVU School of Medicine is creating a Department of Hematology & Oncology; d. Organizational (Departmental) Change at the West Virginia University School of Medicine: The WVU School of Medicine is creating a Department of Cancer Prevention and Control; and e. Assessment of Strategic Initiatives Units and the Office of General Counsel; 8. Consent Agenda (for Board Review and Action), including a. Entry of Institutional Undergraduate Fee Waivers and Institutional Graduate and Professional Fee Waivers; b. Appointment to County Extension Committees; and c. Naming Opportunity for Non-Academic Building; 9. Presidents Report; 10. The next regular board meeting is scheduled for November 17, 2023; and 11.  Adjournment  Other items may become apparent or need attention and may be added to the business agenda of the meeting; attention is called to the fact that the agenda of the meeting will be available three days in advance by calling 304-293-2562 or at the website: http://bog.wvu.edu/ - items of interest may be added to the agenda up to 48 hours prior to the date of meeting.
